title: Create pricing simulation website for leather goods export business

requirements.text: Create a frontend interface displaying 5 distinct market sections, each showing market number, capacity, and fixed cost
acceptanceCriteria: Five market sections are visible on the page
Each section displays its market number (1-5)
Each section shows capacity value in units
Each section shows fixed cost in Indian Rupees (₹)

requirements.text: Implement price selection mechanism for each market allowing users to choose from 9 price points: ₹2,500, ₹3,000, ₹3,500, ₹4,000, ₹4,500, ₹5,000, ₹5,500, ₹6,000, ₹6,500

quotes: allow the user to choose a price in 5 different export markets

acceptanceCriteria: Each market section has a price selector with all 9 price options
Price options are displayed in Indian Rupees (₹) format
User can independently select different prices for each market

requirements.text: Implement automatic demand lookup from the demand table when a price is selected: 2500→850, 3000→760, 3500→700, 4000→640, 4500→585, 5000→530, 5500→480, 6000→435, 6500→395

quotes: When user selects a price, demand should automatically update from this table

acceptanceCriteria: Demand value updates immediately when price is changed
Demand lookup matches the exact mapping from the table
Demand is displayed clearly for each market

requirements.text: Calculate and display Quantity Sold for each market as the minimum of Demand and Capacity
acceptanceCriteria: Quantity Sold never exceeds market capacity
Quantity Sold never exceeds demand for selected price
Quantity Sold is displayed for each market

requirements.text: Calculate and display Revenue for each market using formula: Revenue = Price × Quantity Sold
acceptanceCriteria: Revenue calculation multiplies selected price by quantity sold
Revenue is displayed in Indian Rupees (₹) format
Revenue updates when price changes

requirements.text: Calculate and display Variable Cost for each market using marginal cost of ₹1,200 per unit: Variable Cost = ₹1,200 × Quantity Sold
acceptanceCriteria: Variable cost calculation uses exactly ₹1,200 per unit
Variable cost is displayed in Indian Rupees (₹) format
Variable cost updates when quantity sold changes

requirements.text: Calculate and display Total Cost for each market using formula: Total Cost = Fixed Cost + Variable Cost

quotes: Total Cost = Fixed Cost + Variable Cost

acceptanceCriteria: Total cost includes both fixed and variable components
Total cost is displayed in Indian Rupees (₹) format
Total cost updates when variable cost changes

requirements.text: Calculate and display Profit for each market using formula: Profit = Revenue − Total Cost
acceptanceCriteria: Profit calculation subtracts total cost from revenue
Profit is displayed in Indian Rupees (₹) format
Profit can be negative when costs exceed revenue
Profit updates when price or calculations change

requirements.text: Add a toggle control for Market 5 with two states: 'Enter Market' and 'Do Not Enter'. When 'Do Not Enter' is selected, set Market 5 profit to ₹0 and disable price selection

quotes: Add a toggle for Market 5: Enter Market / Do Not Enter
If user selects 'Do Not Enter', profit for Market 5 = 0

acceptanceCriteria: Toggle control is visible only for Market 5
Toggle has clear 'Enter Market' and 'Do Not Enter' labels
When 'Do Not Enter' is selected, Market 5 profit displays ₹0
When 'Do Not Enter' is selected, price selection is disabled or hidden for Market 5
When toggled back to 'Enter Market', normal profit calculation resumes

requirements.text: Display all calculation results (Quantity Sold, Revenue, Variable Cost, Total Cost, Profit) for each market in a clear, organized format with Indian Rupee (₹) formatting where applicable
acceptanceCriteria: All five calculated values are visible for each market
Monetary values use Indian Rupee (₹) symbol and appropriate number formatting
Layout is clean and easy to read
Results update in real-time when prices or toggle state changes

requirements.text: Design the interface with a simple, clean aesthetic suitable for a business simulation tool, using a cohesive color scheme with warm earth tones (browns, tans, creams) that reflect the leather goods industry
acceptanceCriteria: Visual design uses warm, professional colors appropriate for leather goods context
Layout is uncluttered and focuses on functionality
Typography is legible and professional
Color scheme is applied consistently across all market sections

constraints: Use marginal cost of exactly ₹1,200 per unit
All calculations must be performed client-side in the frontend
nonGoals: Editable market parameters or demand curves
